data.title: IBM in $1.2bn play for Sequent
data.meta_description: IBM Corporation has made a $US810 million ($1.2 billion) move on Sequent Computer Systems in a long-rumoured acquisition which sees the world's largest computer company break tradition by buying a fellow hardware supplier.
data.text:
IBM Corporation has made a $US810 million ($1.2 billion) move on Sequent Computer Systems in a long-rumoured acquisition which sees the world's largest computer company break tradition by buying a fellow hardware supplier.

The IBM purchase price equates to $US18 a share. Sequent shares closed at $US17932 following the announcement in the US overnight.
